subject: Business
title: Social Proof in Marketing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Social Proof in Marketing.

hook.text: 'Join 10 million happy customers.' You've seen this line everywhere. It works every time.

buildup.text: Social proof means we look to others' behavior as evidence of the right choice.

discovery.text: Robert Cialdini proved it: hotel towel reuse went up 26% when signs said 'most guests reuse their towels.'

twist.text: Negative social proof backfires. 'Millions evade taxes' actually increased tax evasion.

climax.text: Reviews, testimonials, and user counts all exploit this. We trust the crowd more than the brand.

punchline.text: Show people what others are doing. They'll follow.

quiz.question: Why can negative social proof backfire?
